## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinessaupdater">MachineSSAUpdater</a> - This class updates SSA form for a set of virtual registers defined in multiple blocks.

This is used when code duplication or another unstructured transformation wants to rewrite a set of uses of one vreg with uses of a set of vregs.

Definition at line 35 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinessaupdater-h">MachineSSAUpdater.h</a>.

### GetValueInMiddleOfBlock() {#a670da7741129c7d591dc19951ecce6c3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Register MachineSSAUpdater::GetValueInMiddleOfBlock (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; BB, bool ExistingValueOnly=false)</>}>
GetValueInMiddleOfBlock - Construct SSA form, materializing a value that is live in the middle of the specified block.

If ExistingValueOnly is true then this will only return an existing value or $noreg; otherwise new instructions may be inserted to materialize a value.

GetValueInMiddleOfBlock is the same as GetValueAtEndOfBlock except in one important case: if there is a definition of the rewritten value after the &#39;use&#39; in BB. Consider code like this: 

<CodeBlock>
 X1 = ...
</CodeBlock> SomeBB: <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/localizer-cpp/#a428090a453f41a199ef67fc3f2179fbc">use(X)</a> X2 = ... br Cond, SomeBB, OutBB

In this case, there are two values (X1 and X2) added to the AvailableVals set by the client of the rewriter, and those values are both live out of their respective blocks. However, the use of X happens in the <em>middle</em> of a block. Because of this, we need to insert a new PHI node in SomeBB to merge the appropriate values, and this value isn&#39;t live out of the block.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinessaupdater-h/#l00099">99</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinessaupdater-h">MachineSSAUpdater.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinessaupdater-cpp/#l00143">143</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinessaupdater-cpp">MachineSSAUpdater.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### RewriteUse() {#a71a08885f7838dc5a544816a357e2ec7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MachineSSAUpdater::RewriteUse (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a> &amp; U)</>}>
RewriteUse - Rewrite a use of the symbolic value.

This handles PHI nodes, which use their value in the corresponding predecessor. Note that this will not work if the use is supposed to be rewritten to a value defined in the same block as the use, but above it. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> &#39;AddAvailableValue&#39;s added for the use&#39;s block will be considered to be below it.

This handles PHI nodes, which use their value in the corresponding predecessor.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinessaupdater-h/#l00107">107</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinessaupdater-h">MachineSSAUpdater.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinessaupdater-cpp/#l00229">229</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinessaupdater-cpp">MachineSSAUpdater.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Private Member Functions

### GetValueAtEndOfBlockInternal() {#a522923da0cd46304c2e8a56dc3e99018}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Register MachineSSAUpdater::GetValueAtEndOfBlockInternal (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; BB, bool ExistingValueOnly=false)</>}>
GetValueAtEndOfBlockInternal - <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> to see if AvailableVals has an entry for the specified BB and if so, return it.

If not, construct SSA form by first calculating the required placement of PHIs and then inserting new PHIs where needed.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinessaupdater-h/#l00112">112</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinessaupdater-h">MachineSSAUpdater.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinessaupdater-cpp/#l00374">374</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinessaupdater-cpp">MachineSSAUpdater.cpp</a>.
